page.title: 02DEER FARM TEANASSIE AREA
page.content: Cluanie-an-Teanassie is a deer farm It has 1500 acres of land, 1000 acres being hill land comprising scrub, birch and bracken, 250 acres are grass land and 250 acres are woodland.The latter is very important in deer farming as it provides shelter and a place where the hinds have their calves. There are 700 head of deer-350 hinds, 300 calves and 50 stags. In winter they are fed on a variety of concentrates. There is a private abbatoir on the farm where the owners do their own slaughtering and buchering. Different parts of the animal are cut up,weighed and packaged.Each package label shows the part of the animal,weight,price per lb and and the cost of the package.The venison is sold locally and some is exported, mainly to New York
